The toe box is wide and my toes can spread out and the cloth material on the outside keeps your feet feeling like you’re barefoot. Highly recommend.

Very comfortable and I have big feet. It fits perfect.
these are made with pretty solid material and great value for the price. preference wise not my favorite style but these are great alternative to the normal expensive barefoot shoes.

评论概述: almost a perfect fit but they feel nice
评论详情: I wear a men's US size 12 in pretty much every shoe but with this shoe, the left foot needs about a half size bigger. They feel more like 11 3/4 instead of 12. I bought another pair of this companies shoes last year and I still wear them around the house in the warm weather. They have held up really well and have not broken and are really comfortable wide low top shoes.

评论概述: Day one so far so good
评论详情: Immediately comfortable. No break in period.  Try a marathon runners knot if you think the tongue is too short.  They ARE true to size. Great ankle support. Will write back after a couple months of really testing them.
Bien

The wide toe box is most important to me having super wide feet. They are super comfortable all day long.  For the price you’re getting a great shoe. I’ve paid four times as much for a known brand name barefoot shoes that don’t even compare.

评论概述: most garbage shoe i ever bought

评论概述: Great intro to barefoot style shoes.
评论详情: Recommend to size down 0.5 to 1 if you're used to narrow/conventional sized shoes like I have been (example: I wear 9.5 in nike, I got these the same size but a size 9 would be a better fit) These pair are cushioned around the heel, soft to the touch, have drain holes (no filter), flexible and material appears to be durable and well put together.

评论概述: Great looks and very comfortable shoes.
评论详情: Bought these shoes because I needed something more comfortable than boots, couldn't be happier.  They're like walking on pillows, all day comfort with the look of work shoes.  Would highly recommend these for anyone.
Gift for husband, very comfortable

Bought these for my husband for Christmas. He has always gotten converse sneakers for casual wear but I decided to get these for him because he likes barefoot/minimalist shoes. The wide toe box is much more comfortable for him and they are similar in quality to converse (but half the price).

So far I like them, good stable platforms shoes for walking and working out as long as your not running in them. For the value this is an awesome purchase, my only complaint is the are to wide at the toe.  But very flexible and comfortable
Good walking shoe .
These 20 wide are a great fit for my husband. The soft sole makes for great comfort.

I ordered a size 13, which is my usual shoe size, but these are definitely a size too small. Otherwise they seem like a quality shoe, just not properly sized. If there was a size 14 available I would have them replaced.

评论概述: Best minimalist shoes I've ever owned
评论详情: I have 7 different kinds of minimalist shoes and these are by far the least expensive (about half the cost of most of them) and they are the best in every category. They never slip, as opposed to quite a few of the others. They have just enough cushion that I can still feel the ground pretty well, but I'm able to walk over rocks without feeling the sharp edges on them. They fit just right, they are good for occasional sprinting, and they have just a bit more structure than most of my other ones without it being too much. The only problem is that they don't come in red, but I painted them so now I have the perfect shoe! I also think they look really normal, which I'm a fan of. All my other red minimalist shoes would definitely go well on a clown.
Lightweight, fit and functional barefoot shoe is great and affordable for everyday wear.

I have wide feet so typical converse and pf flyers don't work for me. These are a great replacement if you want a canvas shoe. Quality seems on point for what I paid.

This is the best shoe ever for people with wide feet. Best part is you don't even have to wear socks with them, making it a perfect summer shoe for people who don't like sandals. Little hard to take off though.
They are really nice and super comfy. They feel really good on my feet!

They’re quite comfortable, like walking barefoot but without getting your feetsies dirty, and provide ankle support. As the title suggests though, they’re not for everyone. The laces are like a fine dance of tug of war and a guessing game of how tight can I get these bad boys before I can’t feel my foot. The quality is all there for the price. The laces however, they leave much to be desired. I wore them twice and on a shelf they went for eternity, cause i’m no quitter and won’t return something I may deem as useful should I need to do some “grounding” but without the pain of actually doing it.
Like most stuff from China, I didn't expect top quality but I would have kept them if my toes weren't jammed into the front.
I like the style, they are durable. Only negative is they can be hard to put on.

I'm on my feet for many hours a day, and I use these shoes for work and they're absolutely the best shoe. Any foot pain I used to have I no longer have thanks to how barefoot these shoes are. They're so flexible and thin but still safe enough for my workplace because of the full coverage. I definitely recommend because they're stylish too and they look like Vans which I love!

I saw these on the feet of a woman at a flea market and took a picture of them so I could go home and order myself a pair.  The things that I love about them are the fit -- nice wide toe box -- and the style.  I wear them to work and walk in them 8K+ steps a day.  I really appreciate the minimalist quality and the zero-drop.  They feel great to walk in.  I don't miss a squishy sole.I second the notion that they're annoying to put on -- you really have to loosen the laces quite a ways down to get your feet into them.  Coming from wearing slip-on shoes daily, this is an inconvenience, but does not override the style and fit and comfort of these shoes.

I have bunions and need space for my toes. These shoes only make sense being the same shape as the foot, not jamming your toes together. Should have bought some of these sooner.  They’re comfy, lightweight, grippy, seem durable so far, and look pretty sweet.
I have the low-rise regular sneaker version in size 10, but when I ordered these in size 10, they fit like clown shoes - ridiculously big.
Great fit and feet felt great after whole day on mostly cement floor at work.

Using the included sizing chart will not help; in fact I ordered a size larger than what the chart stated I should get and I still got shoes that were way too small. When they say barefoot feel, they're not joking. These things have zero support and it feels like walking on plastic. If that's for you, cool. If not, pass.  On another note, the 11 wide fits me who is an 11.5

Believe me I wear expensive shoes Birkenstocks, Danco’s . Bloodstones! And these are far more comfortable than any of those! Get them

I first started looking at barefoot shoes for the wide toe box. It's so comfortable! Then the zero drop heel turned out to be very good for my arthritic knees. I noticed that I was walking with less pain, but I really noticed the difference when I put on an old pair of shoes to work in the garden. They were well broken in and nearly flat, but I felt the added pressure on my knees immediately. I love those old shoes, but I will never wear them again. I am a barefoot lady all the way, now! For those wondering, there is a blue cast to the shoes. I wondered and, as I hoped, they are exactly that blue/grey color, despite being described as grey.

Great shoes, but definitely not for work if your on your feet pulling items off shelves or gathering items for deliveries for long periods of time. I love how light they are and durable, only issue is that the ball of my right foot tends to swell or become super sore while wearing them at work which makes it a little difficult to staying walking in and the next morning my feet feel stiff/sore and hard to move around at first when waking up. Could just be I need to get my foot looked at but they are great shoes and I would recommend them to anyone looking to try and get your feet back to more of a stable grounding the modern day shoes.

评论概述: My second pair of Whitin shoes
评论详情: I decided to go full bore into barefoot shoes after years of plantar fasciitis pain. This is the second pair of Whitin shoes I've bought, and they both have been great! So far no issues with quality or durability. I wear them to work in and I'm on my feet all day.

For a wide toe box shoe, it's just ok. Just to make my pros and cons simple and easy to see.  Pros: 1. Price 2. Decent wide toe box and comfort 3. Decent transitional point for getting into barefoot shoes, but this isn't a real barefoot shoe 4. Looks like a normal shoe  Cons: 1. Really stiff canvas 2. Noticeable pinch point right at the first eyelit of the shoe (first point where the shoelace goes in) 3. No half sizes and if you are, you should size up 4. Very warm and not breathable  If this shoe was done in a high top knit, I'd probably like it a lot more

These shoes are nice for the wide foot space as it is very hard to find shoes that have the wide width but the tongue on them are to short. Need to be at least 1 inch more so strings do not touch your skin.
I love love love barefoot shoes. These make me feel like I’m in style as well as doing the right thing for my feet. Absolutely recommend a spray protectant, it has helped a lot keeping them white.

评论概述: Color fades extremely fast within 20 wares
评论详情: Very disappointed with the quality of the shoes. After 20 wears the toes we're wearing and now only after 2 months of use. Color is nearly faded to dingy gray.

评论概述: Seems like a decent, budget friendly, comfortable, minimalist shoe with good toe space.
评论详情: I got the high-top black canvas black sole. I normally buy 11 or 11.5 (44 or 45). I ordered the 11, as there was no half size option. They sent me a 45. Right out of the box fits well and is very comfortable.  At just under $50, I figured these would be a cheap temporary summertime barefoot shoe while I figure out something better. Right out of the box they are more comfortable and better toe box than my $200+ Lems. They're like a classic Vans with more toe room and a more barefoot feeling sole, which is exactly what I was hoping for. _ Pros: Lower end of the price range for a barefoot shoe. Comfortable right out of the box before even breaking them in. Good room in the toe box without looking like clown shoes. Super light weight, flexible, and very good ground feel. Breathable, like you're barely wearing a shoe. They dry quick. Good grip on the sole, even in wet conditions. Seems like the sole may end up holding up better than the other barefoot shoes I mentioned. They look nice, like a classic Vans vibe. _ Cons: The canvas is not at all water resistant, even walking thru damp grass my socks got wet (I may try waterproofing or waxing them) The tongue is pretty short, it would be better if it was a bit more substantial. The rubber stinks, but hopefully this will fade. The insoles seem pretty flimsy, I may end up swapping them out. _ Neutral: The laces are suuuper long. This could be a pro or a con, but I have to wrap the laces around the ankle so that the excess doesn't hang down to the ground, even with double knots. _ Overall, they seem pretty decent and quite comfortable super minimal barefoot shoe for warm dry weather. We'll see how long they last. If they end up being durable I am considering buying a second pair.

I had heard about this brand for a few years now. Finally tried out this casual model and very glad I did. Really makes you wonder where that extra $120 is going when you buy a pair of Nikes instead of these. They are both made in China?  Excellent natural foot shape, I can wear my actual shoe size in these and not have to size up to fit width constraints.  Its a great looking classic design that looks even better when you remove the 1.5" high heel as they have done here.  lightweight and stylin for 1/4 the price. Can't beat it.  they are not very breathable, as you might expect from a mostly canvas casual shoe.

Getting older, having a heel of any size would cause my neck and back pain within minutes. After finding these WHITIN barefoot sneakers, I no longer have this problem. This is, by far, the greatest purchase I have ever made from Amazon! I have one pair for around the house, and a second pair, for when I'm out and about. They truly are like walking barefooted! I would recommend these (and have) to anyone who's looking for the perfect fit and may have back/neck problems like I do. I will NEVER wear any other shoe again!!!

评论概述: Smaller than expected. The Top isn't high at all, is regular.
评论详情: The shoes are smaller than advertised, and the hi-top description is misleading. Not good sizing.
I feel smart wearing these because of the price and how a year has went by and thereby still in great shape. These shoes shape are alternating my life for the better, genius.

I was skeptical about these shoes because of the low price but they definitely go above and beyond the price point! They are super spacious in the tow box area and the quality is awesome! I definitely want to get more pairs.
Very squeaky and harder to get on then the low cut model

I've had these shoes for the last 2 months or so and I love them. They give me great toe space, are comfortable, light weight, and look nice. I have been on the fence about moving to bare foot shoes and these seem like a nice place to start.
Very comfortable shoes and very stylish, True to size .

These are perfect drumming shoes IMO.  Simple, minimalist design, they feel kinda like halfway between wearing extra thin and lightweight Chucks and a pair of house slippers.  Very flexible and thin sole feels almost like playing barefoot.  The ankle can be cinched down if you like more ankle support, but personally I'm tying them a bit loose and they stay put very comfortably but give me a really good range of motion for things like fast doubles.  The wide toebox give my toes plenty of space to really feel solidly rooted to the pedals.  And they aren't ugly either, just look like old-school Vans if you aren't looking too closely.  I've got wide and flat "hobbit feet," usually wear 10.5 Wide and my toes still feel squished in most shoes, when I can I try to buy EEE. The 11 Wides fit perfectly and don't rub against the sides of my toes AT ALL.  Just get these if you're a drummer looking for minimalist/wrestling type shoes and don't wanna drop the $100+ for the overpriced name brand minimalist shoes advertised on social media.

评论概述: The grey/blue is actually purple/blue in person
评论详情: Besides the color being a little more purple than we would’ve liked, these shoes are great for the price point. So comfortable on the toes, great grip on the sole, perfect for working out

Absolutely loved these wide minimalist shoes. Ultralight weight, good grip and great looks. Only complaint I had was the grey color had a blueish tint to it and I really wanted a straight grey color. Otherwise an awesome pair of shoes!
They make my feet smile 😎

评论概述: A few months in and still great.
评论详情: I bought these about two and a half months ago, I wear them to the gym and just about everywhere else that requires any walking, heck I wore them hiking once. Wonderful shoe, it fits my foot like a glove and I couldn't be happier with it. They are also comfortable for a long time, I can almost forget I'm wearing them they are so comfortable. I would say they hold up well too, other than needing to clean some dirt and dust off here and there I have no issues with how the shoes are holding up.

These shoes are awesome. Ever since I started my journey with zero drop shoes, I started with other shoes from the company. Each and every one of them I love! These are a combo of zero drop and vans hi tops, they look and feel great! I am pretty stoked on these, they even came laced up the way I like it, ready to rock! I have like ten different pairs for  my various needs. Go check um out. I think the only thing to make these that much better if the had them in faux suede, other than that they rock.

I found them very difficult to get on and my feet slid around in them, thus making me feel really unstable. They looked like clown shoes on my feet, with the toe box flapping against the ground. I measured my feet as directed.
My new favorites

These 'Minimalist Barefoot Sneakers' are really a more robust sort of house slipper, albeit one that requires serious technique and time to get on and off.  Unlike house slippers, due to the general design of the shores and lacing laces there is no slipping these on and off.  You need to practice and develop a strategy for getting these one and off and lacing them up.  And although I'm happy for the experience I don't think I'll be buying another pair very soon.  As a sufferer of peripheral neuropathy I fail to find the charm in the 'barefoot' feel.
Bought this for my son.  It has plenty room for his foot.  No discomfort at the sides of his foot.  That's a plus.

评论概述: Comfortable, and well built for the price!
评论详情: Overall feel comfortable and look nice, especially for the price!

Not wide enough in the toes. They're better than most conventional shoes, but still far too narrow.  About as wide as Vivos (which have always been too narrow in the toes). Whitins can work in a pinch but are not as wide, comfortable, or healthy as Freet, Belenka, FiveFingers, etc.
Satisfactory comfortability, style, and quality.

评论概述: Good first impression, but one grommet is blocked
评论详情: My first impression is that these are good for the money - I don't see any defects that would make me worry about longevity. Toe box is decently wide relative to most brands, as advertised. Insoles are very cheap but that's to be expected.  The only real problem so far is that the grommets either need to be moved towards the toes by about 3/4 of an inch, or they need to cut the foam liner back towards the heel. As it stands, the rear grommet is closed off by the foam/fabric liner so I don't expect it will be doing much venting, meaning that only one grommet can actually serve as ventilation right now. This problem is present on both shoes, so I don't think it's a one off error.
Sent them back, too big and cheap feeling.
